title: LMEC Data Description Schema
description: The context captured by this schema is broken into five categories: basic citation information and general properties about the data, information on the constellation of resources surrounding the data, context about how the data has been processed or improved upon for public use, information about how the existence of the data may impact the people it is about, and finally, information about fields that have been flagged as either missing or of particular importance.

citation.description: The properties in this category pertain to basic citation information and general properties about the dataset or project.

title.description: full name of the dataset or project

shortDescription.description: Short description of the dataset or project

contextProvider.description: Name of the person describing this dataset or project

contextOnBehalfOf.description: If the person filling out the context is different than the person responsbile for the creation or processing of the dataset or project, note that here

contextPublicationDate.description: Date this context was first made available

entryType.description: Provides flexibility on how context information is displayed, depending on whether it is describing a unique datasets, or a collection of datasets that have been somehow processed together into a data 'recipe' or project, for the purposes of analysis and visualization.

subComponentOf.description: If this record is for a dataset, populate this array with the URIs of larger data projects this dataset is included in. To be used within data discovery environments

includesDatasets.description: If this record is for a project, populate this array with the URIs of the datasets that are components of the project. To be used within data discovery environments

relatedTo.description: Way to link similar record URIs for discovery

resourceConstellation.description: The context captured in this section lends insight into the overall universe of materials surrounding a particular dataset, data project, or collection of datasets, to give someone first encountering it an overview of all known resources that may be helpful in understanding and working with the data.

rawData.description: 'Source' data, prior to any processing described in this document

officialMaintenance.description: If another organization is responsible for the hosting and upkeep of this source data, use this field to describe that information.

typicalUpdates.description: If this data is regularly updated, describe the typical nature of the changes

suggestedEntryPoint.description: Reference to the most logical place for someone new to this dataset to begin to understand how to work with it

codebooks.description: Reference to any codebooks or data dictionaries intended to aid interpretation of the data's attributes or field names

analyses.description: Reference to related analyses or prominent publications using the data

tutorials.description: Reference to guides, tutorials, Jupyter notebooks, or any resource with people-centered instructions on how to work with, use and understand this data

audioProvidingContext.description: If audio narratives describing information about this dataset is easier to capture than text, this field points to those audio files and provides context about them

imagesProvidingContext.description: References to screenshots or photos that lend additional context about the dataset or steps taken to process the data

process.description: In this section, information about how the data has been changed or augmented for public use, or in order to facilitate analysis or use within the larger project should be provided. This part of the document should be as people-friendly as possible.

overview.description: A clear, sequential overview of all steps taken and the reasons for making changes or carrying out processing should be provided here.

processContextProvider.description: Name of the person filling out this context about the processing

steps.description: Detailed information about each step in the processing sequence, explained in a way that someone else working with the starting data could perform the exact same steps and arrive at a similar result.

stepMotivation.description: Explanation of why this step advanced the overall goals of improving the dataset for use, why was it necessary?

droppedFields.description: General explanation if fields were dropped from the source data.

addedFields.description: General explanation if fields were added or inferred to the source data as part of these processing steps

successes.description: General explanation of how steps taken were beneficial to the improvement of this data for public use.

challenges.description: What was difficult about this project, known hangups, missing information, assumptions made, guesses, practical but questionable steps taken

sandtraps.description: Forewarnings or words-to-the wise for someone else wanting to work with this data or project

gapsInProcessingInformation.description: What is unknown about the process for cleaning, joining, analyzing, visualizing within this project that leaves meaningful gaps in understanding how to interpret or use it again

people.description: If the data or project involves people, this section of the context should be populated to the fullest ability. If the project involves people, and these questions cannot be answered, they are intended to facilitate conversation and consideration about why this information is not avaialble.

sampleSizeReasons.description: Explanation for this choice of sample size

knownProblems.description: Place to mention known problems or considerations related to sample size and method.

marginOfError.description: Place to knote considerations related to margins of error.

aggregationProblems.description: If there are known issues or considerations related to the way the data is aggregated, describe them here.

consent.description: Describe the degree to which the people included in this dataset knew about, agreed, and understood how their data would be used.

anonymization.description: If this data was masked or anonymized in any way, please describe that process here, including how measures of genuine privacy are being assured.

properties.privacyIssues: Are there any known privacy issues or considerations related to this dataset?

whoIncluded.description: Explanation of who was included in this dataset

whoLeftOut.description: Explanation of who was not included in this dataset

whoCollected.description: Who was involved in collecting this data?

endDate.description: When did data collection wrap up?

whoConceived.description: Who is responsible for the conception of the collection project?

whoDesigned.description: Who designed the survey or data model?

whoExcluded.description: Who was excluded from the conception and design of the survey or data model?

representation.description: Were the communities who this data about included in the conception or collection process? If yes, please describe this process. If no, please explain why.

collectionConditions.description: Are there any known conditions surrounding the collection process which could have impacted results? For example, global pandemic, housing insecurity, documentation status, and so on.

collectorsLocations.description: Were the data collectors from the communities in which the data is being collected about?

collectionMethods.description: By which methods were the data collected?

fundingRequirements.description: Were there any requirements of funding that impacted this data at any point during the data information lifecycle?

originalPurpose.description: What was the original, state purpose for this data upon conception and acquiring funding?

potentialBenefit.description: If there are people who potentially benefit from this data, or have some stake in its quality, use this space to comment on who, how, and why.

potentialHarm.description: If there are people who potentially be harmed by this data, or have some stake in its quality, use this space to comment on who, how, and why.

vulnerability.description: If the populations included are typically undercounted or overcounted, please comment on how the data being publicly available could have an impact on them.

flaggedFields.description: This section is to capture knowledge that the contributor has about why information may be missing from context, or of the context provided, which information should be raised in prominence for others to view. ðŸš§Under construction ðŸš§ There are a lot of ways to handle this on the discovery side, but Belle thinks its really important to remember that we are not always going to know what is important to capture, we cannot prescribe this, and that capturing what the contributor thinks is most important and storing that information in a way that is married to the rest of the context is important. This is also a way to drown out massive amounts of irrelevent metadata in a discovery setting, while letting the person who knows the most about the data pick what is featured.

missingValuesNotes.description: In cases where fields were left blank because the contect contributr did not know the answer, this is a place for the contributor to name that, and possibly provide some information on why they think this information is not available.

missingGeneral.description: Are there any major issues with missing values in the data, and could you please comment on what and why

selectedFields.description: One idea: In the context collection tool, checkboxes appear with field names for the fields they have filled out, and the contributor can select the ones they think are most important for people to know about this dataset. Those field names are sent to the array and used later in discovery.

featuredExplanation.description: If you would like to, here is a place to provide an explanation of why you selected the fields you selected.
